source_sentence: 佛說福力太子因緣經卷第三
translation: Foshuo fuli taizi yinnian jing, vol. 3

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿傳
translation: Xitian Translation of the Tripiṭaka, Chaofeng Dafu, Xu Guanluqing's Biography

source_sentence: 法大師賜紫沙門臣施護等奉　詔譯
translation: The Great Master Dharma bestowed upon the purple monks, ministers Shi Hao and others, in accordance with the imperial edict, to translate this scripture.

source_sentence: 「爾時帝釋天主，見是福力，現生果報，希有瑞相，又知人天悉皆胥悅，心頗異之。
translation: "It was then that the lord Indra saw this merit power, the rare and brilliant appearance of the rewards of birth, and the knowledge that all humans and gods were pleased with him, and he quite disliked it.

source_sentence: 乃謂福力太子言：『太子！
translation: He then addressed the prince of merit, saying, 'Prince!

source_sentence: 汝今如是勤修勝行，有何所求？』
translation: What do you seek now, as you so diligently cultivate your excellent practice?'

source_sentence: 太子白言：『天主！
translation: The crown prince said, 'Lord of heaven!

source_sentence: 我為求證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提果，拯拔一切有情，出生死海，悉令安住究竟涅槃。』
translation: I seek to realize the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, to save all sentient beings from being born into the ocean of death, and to make them all live in perfect nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 時帝釋天主，知福力太子勤求阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，深心不動，猶若須彌，稱可其意，作是讚言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: Knowing that Prince Fuli was diligently seeking unsurpassed, Samantabhadra, and that his profound mind was unmoving like Sumeru, Lord Indra then commended his intentions and praised him, saying, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 大士！
translation: Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 汝有廣大最上願力，必當速證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。』
translation: 'With the power of your vast and supreme vow, you will quickly realize unsurpassed, correct enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 如是言已，隱身不現。
translation: After saying this, he hid himself and didn't show up.

source_sentence: 「復次，於後彼國之王耆年而終，其王未立灌頂太子，於是王之宗族臣佐人民，共會議言：『我等于今當令何人紹灌頂位？』
translation: "Furthermore, when the king of that country then reached the end of his elder years and hadn't yet crowned a prince, his clan, ministers, and people all met and said, 'Which of us will now be made to assume the position of consecration?'

source_sentence: 時一人言：『若有福力大名稱者，可宜紹位。』
translation: One of the men then said, 'If there's someone of great merit and renown, it would be appropriate to promote them to their position.'

source_sentence: 如是言已，眾意悉同，即遣使人周行求訪。
translation: After he said this, the consensus was shared, and he sent an envoy around to ask for him.

source_sentence: 「是時福力太子，當繼王位，善根開發，與諸侍從，出遊園林；太子行時，道路平坦，觸處皆無荊棘砂礫；於其中路，吉祥相現：細雨散空，旋布其頂；異色飛鳥，順次宛轉；童男童女，發勝妙聲，踊躍奔馳，咸生歡悅；一切人眾，身毛喜豎，皆得輕安。
translation: "When the blessed prince succeeded to the throne, his good roots developed, and he and his attendants traveled through the park, the path was smooth and free of thorns and gravel everywhere he touched as he traveled, and in his path there were auspicious appearances: fine rain scattered in the sky and spread out on his head, birds of different colors flew in procession, boys and girls made wonderful noises and rushed about, all rejoicing, and all the people's hair stood on end in joy and well-being.

source_sentence: 又聞空中悅意之言。
translation: They also heard pleasant words in the air.

source_sentence: 太子覩斯事相，即起思念：『此相出現，我當決定紹灌頂位。』
translation: Seeing this, the prince began to think, 'When this sign appears, I'll surely reach the stage of consecration.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，進詣園中，受諸福樂。
translation: After that thought, he went into the garden and enjoyed the benefits and pleasures.

source_sentence: 其園有一大無憂樹，華開茂盛，太子於彼安然寢寐。
translation: In that garden was a large, non-sorrowful tree with flowers in full bloom, and the crown prince slept there peacefully.

source_sentence: 諸同往者，樂華果故，各於園中，隨處遊賞。
translation: Those who went with him enjoyed the flowers and fruits, so they each went to the garden and enjoyed them as they pleased.

source_sentence: 又復太子，福威力故，彼有龍王，忽然從地涌出千葉微妙蓮華，其量廣大，色香具足，最上可愛。
translation: Again, because of the prince's merit and might, there was a dragon king who suddenly produced out of the ground a thousand subtle lotus leaves that were enormous, full of color and fragrance, and most desirable.

source_sentence: 而彼龍王，又以神力徐置太子在蓮華上；爾時太子都無動覺。
translation: That dragon king then used his supernormal powers to slowly place the prince on top of the lotus; at that point, the prince didn't even stir.

source_sentence: 由是漸過食時，日正中分，餘諸樹影悉皆移動，唯無憂樹影覆太子身，如故不動。
translation: Thus, as the meal gradually passed, at the middle of the day, the shadows of all the other trees moved, except for the shadow of the tree of Wuzu, which covered the prince's body and didn't budge as before.

source_sentence: 又彼園中諸餘華樹，皆悉傾向，大無憂樹，吉祥勝相，悅意可觀。
translation: All the other flowering trees in the garden tended toward the great tree of Wisdom, which had an auspicious and beautiful appearance that was pleasing to look at.

source_sentence: 「時福力太子，夢見自身處穢污上，又見自身穢污所染，又見自以舌舐虛空，又見自身蓮華中立，又見自身上起山峯，又見眾人頂禮於己。
translation: "In a dream, the prince of merit then saw himself standing on top of a defilement, seeing himself stained by a defilement, seeing himself licking the sky with his tongue, seeing himself standing amidst lotus flowers, seeing himself rising from a mountain peak, and seeing people prostrating to him.

source_sentence: 太子寤已，隨應占察如上所夢：『如我夢見自身在於穢污上者，我必應居灌頂王位，大富自在，斯為前相。
translation: When he awoke, the prince then investigated the dream as described above, saying, "If I saw myself in a dream on top of a defiled body, I would surely be placed at the rank of consecrated king and be greatly prosperous and comfortable, and this would be the former mark.

source_sentence: 如我所見穢污染身者，我應處于大師子座。
translation: If I see a body that's defiled, I should be at the seat of the great teacher.

source_sentence: 如我所見上起山峯者，我應於一切處常居最上。
translation: As I see a mountain peak rising above me, I should always be at the top of every place.

source_sentence: 如我所見眾人頂禮者，我應為彼眾所尊重。
translation: As I see people paying homage to me, I should be respected by them.

source_sentence: 如是等事，審占其相，我今決定為灌頂王。』
translation: Examining these things and discerning their characteristics, I'm now certain that I'll be the consecration king.'

source_sentence: 「爾時彼國臣佐，先遣使人周行求訪到彼園中，具見太子次第相續吉祥勝相；心生驚異，此大福力，有大名稱。
translation: "It was then that some ministers from that country first sent an envoy around to the park, and they saw the prince's successive successive auspicious and outstanding appearances, and were astonished at their minds, thinking, 'This is a great power of merit that has a great reputation.'

source_sentence: 即時速還，具陳上事。
translation: He then quickly returned and explained the above matters in detail.

source_sentence: 時諸臣佐，聞彼言已，皆生歡喜。
translation: When the ministers and assistants heard what he said, they all rejoiced.

source_sentence: 即依法儀，悉備所須，行詣園中，授其灌頂，到已見諸吉祥勝相。
translation: They prepared everything they needed according to the rules, went to the garden, gave him a consecration, and saw all the auspicious and brilliant features when they arrived.

source_sentence: 「時福力太子，即於微妙大蓮華上，結加趺坐。
translation: "The prince of merit then sat cross-legged on a large, subtle lotus flower.

source_sentence: 以福力開發故，四大天王奉天莊嚴大師子座，帝釋天主奉天妙蓋及眾寶拂，忉利諸天奉種種寶嚴飾露幔，散眾寶華如雲而下。
translation: Because of the power of the blessing's development, the four great guardian kings of heaven adorned the great prince's throne, the lord of the Indra heavens presented a marvelous canopy and a multitude of precious dusters, and the gods of the Thirty-three heavens presented a dewy curtain adorned with various treasures and scattered multitudes of precious flowers like clouds as they descended.

source_sentence: 四大王天諸天子眾，雨種種寶，奏天微妙可愛音樂，及散妙衣。
translation: A multitude of gods and sons from the four great king gods rained down various treasures, played lovely, subtle music from the gods, and scattered marvelous robes.

source_sentence: 國中園林，周遍清淨，一切悉無荊棘砂礫。
translation: The country's parks and forests are completely clean and clear, and everything is free of thorns and gravel.

source_sentence: 豎立幢幡珠繒交絡，設妙香瓶，散諸異華與天宮等。
translation: Banners and banners are erected, beads and silks are interlaced, wonderful incense vases are placed, and exotic flowers are scattered throughout the celestial palace.

source_sentence: 帝釋天主，勅毘首羯磨天子，普於園林，悉令化出四寶所成廣大樓閣，以備太子隨意受用。
translation: Indra the lord of the gods commanded the god Vaiśravaṇa to make the garden a vast mansion made of the four treasures for the prince's use as he pleased.

source_sentence: 時彼臣佐，又觀如是希有勝相，轉復異之，咸各肅恭，虔命太子處師子座，頂禮尊奉，如其法儀，為授灌頂。
translation: When his ministers and assistants observed such a rare and remarkable appearance, they each turned away, reverently ordered the prince to sit at his lion's seat, paid homage to him, and venerated him, bestowing the consecration according to his rituals.

source_sentence: 太子得灌頂已，身出光明，周遍照耀一由旬量，映蔽日光而不顯現。
translation: After he received the consecration, the crown prince's body emitted a radiance that shone around him for a measure of a yojana and blocked the sun's light without appearing.

source_sentence: 是時眾中，有一類人，見斯光已，咸悉稱言：『此勝光王。』
translation: At the time, there was a certain type of person in the crowd who saw that light and all of them said, 'This is the king of excellent light.'

source_sentence: 一類人言：『此福力王。』
translation: One group of people said, 'This is the King of Blessed Power.'

source_sentence: 「爾時福力王將入王城，帝釋天主等，於其王前，隨依法儀，作供獻已，隱復天宮。
translation: "When King Fuli was about to enter the king's city, the lords of Indra and the others went before him, made offerings according to the rules, and retired to their palaces.

source_sentence: 時福力王，既入城已，善布國政，人民熾盛，安隱豐樂，息諸鬪諍，却除他敵，悉無賊盜、飢饉、疾病，愛護人民，猶如一子。
translation: After entering the city, King Fuli then well-administered the government of the country, the people prospered, were peaceful and abundant, quelled disputes and quelled other enemies, were free of thieves, hunger, and disease, and loved and protected the people like a single son.

source_sentence: 華果樹林，悉皆茂盛，時令不愆，稼穡豐阜，雨澤順時，大地受潤。
translation: Their flowers, fruits, and forests all flourish, their seasons are unobstructed, their crops are abundant, and the earth is nourished by the rains and seas that come at the right time.

source_sentence: 復次，其後王之四兄，聞斯異事，咸生驚怪，共會議言：『福力太子，勝過我等，福慧二全，以福力故，為大國王，最上大富，稱可我心，我等今時宜共往彼。』
translation: Furthermore, when the king's four brothers later heard about this extraordinary event, they were all surprised and agreed, saying, 'The Prince of Fortune is superior to us; he has both merit and wisdom, and because of his merit he's the king of a great country and is most wealthy and praiseworthy to my mind; it's time for us to go there together.'

source_sentence: 於是四兄，同詣福力王所。
translation: So the four brothers went together to the king of merit.

source_sentence: 到已即時咸祝之言：『願汝最勝增長壽命。』
translation: Immediately upon arriving, they all wished, 'May you have the best and increase your life expectancy.'

source_sentence: 又復讚言：『善哉！
translation: Again, they praised him, saying, 'Good!

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 汝昔要期，今能固立福慧若斯，勝過我等，於他國中，統王大位，皆由汝勝福力所成。
translation: You were once expected to be able to establish such a high level of merit and wisdom that you're superior to us, and you've assumed the position of ruler in another country because of your superior fortune.

source_sentence: 我等親朋，具悉瞻覩。』
translation: We, your friends and relatives, have all seen it.'

source_sentence: 「時福力王，從師子座歡喜而下，致敬問訊，如應施設高廣之座，命彼諸兄次第而坐。
translation: "The blessed king then rejoiced as he descended from his lion's seat, paid homage and exchanged greetings, and as he should have done, he made a high and wide seat and ordered his brothers to sit there in order.

source_sentence: 諸兄即令王復本座。
translation: The brothers then told the king to resume his seat.

source_sentence: 眾坐已定，作諸供獻。
translation: After they had all sat down, they made offerings.

source_sentence: 如先所論，互談議已，皆生決定歡喜之心。
translation: After they talked to each other as discussed earlier, they all became decidedly joyous.

source_sentence: 時王起尊重意，各以所奉。
translation: The king then arose with respect and offered what each one had to offer.

source_sentence: 如是集會過二三日，王為諸兄及彼人眾開發，令知福非福事，說伽陀曰：「『無福者墮地獄中，　　受大苦惱常無間；　　或墮餓鬼或畜生，　　受飢渴苦及負重。
translation: After two or three days of this assembly, the king spoke to his brothers and the crowd, making them aware of what's fortunate and what's not fortunate, and said to the gods, "The blameless fall into hell and experience great suffering and torment that lasts forever; they might fall into the existence of hungry ghosts or animals and experience hunger, thirst, pain, and heavy burdens.

source_sentence: 無福之者壞其身，　　無福為奴重疲極，　　無福墮於聾瘂中，　　無福愚鈍多邪慧。
translation: Without good fortune, that person's body is destroyed, without good fortune they become a slave and are exhausted, without good fortune they fall into deafness and dumbness, and without good fortune they are dull and have mistaken wisdom.

source_sentence: 無福之者魑魅著，　　無福之者醜形容，　　無福多於下族生，　　無福心亂人所惡，　　無福之者多迷惑，　　無福為他所輕謗，　　無福之者諸所為，　　雖復勤力不成就。
translation: Without good fortune, demons attach to him, he has an ugly appearance, without good fortune he's often born into a lower clan, without good fortune his mind is disturbed by people's evil, without good fortune he's often confused, without good fortune he's despised by others, and without good fortune he does things that don't obtain despite diligence.

source_sentence: 無福之者身麤澁，　　悉無威光不可意；　　無福之人兄所居，　　草木青潤成枯瘁。
translation: The body of a blameless person is coarse and rough, and it's completely devoid of radiance that's not agreeable. The blameless person's brother lives in a place where grass and trees are green and withered.

source_sentence: 無福人所不隨順，　　外境觸害亦復然；　　諸惡鬼神羅剎娑，　　常時侵嬈無福者。
translation: That blameless person's body isn't compliant, nor is it harmed by external objects; evil spirits and rājasas always prey on the blameless.

source_sentence: 無福者用藥治病，　　返成非藥病增劇；　　由無福故受貧窮，　　復為他人所輕慢。
translation: When a person lacking good fortune uses medicine to treat illness, their illness becomes worse when it's not medicine; because they lack good fortune, they suffer poverty and are also despised by others.

source_sentence: 無福之人生子息，　　其性麤惡眾憎嫌；　　無福者雖眷屬多，　　常時離散生苦惱。
translation: A child born without good fortune has a debilitating nature that's disliked by many, and even though he has many dependents, he's always scattered and produces suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 無福者壞於眼目，　　而復相續諸苦生，　　多病皆由無福因，　　小生疾病固難差。
translation: The lack of good fortune destroys his eyes and vision, and continuous suffering arises; many illnesses are caused by a lack of good fortune, and it's hard to distinguish between minor illnesses.

source_sentence: 無福之人多兇惡，　　無福常發麤惡聲；　　手指攣拳體不完，　　語言人多不信順。
translation: A person without good fortune is often fierce, without good fortune he always makes a coarse, unpleasant noise, his fingers are clenched and fists are incomplete, and he speaks with much disbelief.

source_sentence: 無福之人諸所有，　　王官水火盜賊銷；　　無福唯聞非愛言，　　觸處常生於驚怖。
translation: A person lacking good fortune has possessions, such as kings, officials, fires, thieves, and burglars; a person lacking good fortune hears only unpleasant words and is always frightened when he touches places.

source_sentence: 無福雖居平坦地，　　隨處旋當荊棘生；　　設或植種及經商，　　雖常多作無義利。
translation: Although he lives on level ground, a blameless man's thorns grow everywhere he goes; even if he plants seeds or engages in commerce, he'll always work for no profit.

source_sentence: 無福者於一切時，　　所有財寶皆散壞；　　世間無少顧戀心，　　實不可愛無善利；　　諸無福者如是相，　　智者當知皆破壞。
translation: At all times, the lack of good fortune causes all his possessions to dissipate; the world has no small regard for them, but they are truly unattractive and lack good benefits; the lack of good fortune thus shows such characteristics, and wise people will know that they are all destroyed.

source_sentence: 福者所作善護持，　　於一切時無散失。
translation: The works of the blessed are well guarded, and they aren't scattered at any time.

source_sentence: 福者所行不懈倦，　　常起堅固勇悍心，　　如蓋覆蔭廣無邊，　　復能制除諸惡雨。
translation: What the blessed do doesn't tire, always produces a resolute and courageous mind, like a cover that's limitless in scope and capable of stopping bad rains.

source_sentence: 猶犢隨母常飼乳，　　福者如意善欲同；　　又如劫樹悅意觀，　　常獲一切所欲果。
translation: Like a calf that follows its mother's constant milk, the blessed one shares good intentions as intended; like an eon tree that delights in contemplation, it always obtains all the desired results.

source_sentence: 福者能具忍辱力，　　及得悅意大吉祥；　　信行深固可依從，　　生生皆具妙色相。
translation: The blessed one is endowed with the power of forbearance and attains the great good fortune of pleasing, and he has deep faith and practice to follow, so that all births possess marvelous appearances.

source_sentence: 福者廣布大名稱，　　能具多聞及智慧；　　見者咸生愛樂心，　　又能獲得聞持念。
translation: Blessed is the person who widely disseminates a great reputation, is well-versed, and has wisdom; those who see it will delight in it, and they'll attain the mindfulness of hearing and maintaining it.

source_sentence: 福者臨終無疾病，　　臨終亦復歡喜生，　　極惡境相不現前，　　遠離驚怖及苦惱。
translation: A fortunate person has no illness at the end of their life, and they'll be born rejoicing at the end of their life, with the most unpleasant appearances not showing up, far removed from fear and suffering.

source_sentence: 福者臨終受天樂，　　天宮樓閣現其前；　　忉利諸天夜摩天，　　彼彼天人來引接；　　兜率天宮諸天子，　　化樂天眾亦復然，　　他化自在欲界天，　　咸來衛護於福者。
translation: At the end of his life, the blessed one experiences heavenly bliss, with palaces and mansions in front of him; the gods of the Heaven of Thirty-three and the Yama Heaven, where gods and humans come to guide him; the gods and sons of the palace of Tuṣita, the gods of transformation and bliss, and the gods of the desire realm, where others freely transform him, all come to guard the blessed one.

source_sentence: 福者猶如大梵王，　　俱胝天眾皆宗奉，　　於其一千梵界中，　　廣大尊勝而自在。
translation: The Blessed One is like the great Brahma King, to whom all the myriad gods adhere, who is vastly venerable and at ease in a thousand Brahma realms.

source_sentence: 福者諸所作皆成，　　復常處於快樂位，　　一切皆生愛樂心，　　乃至外境無觸害。』
translation: The blessed one achieves all his works, remains in a happy state, and all become delighted, even when external objects don't harm him.'

source_sentence: 「是時諸兄及其人眾，聞伽陀已，於福力王，心皆信伏，極大歡喜。
translation: "Then, after hearing about the Gadhātu, the brothers and their fellow practitioners were all convinced and greatly rejoiced at the power of merit, King Bhadrapāla.

source_sentence: 現世他生，顯明開示，一向悉知，福力最勝。
translation: In other lifetimes in the present, they were clearly shown and consistently understood to be most powerful in terms of merit.

source_sentence: 「時福力王，為諸人眾廣說福事，開發心已，觀察虛空，作是念言：『快哉！
translation: "After he explained the merits of these people in detail and developed their minds, the king of merit observed space and had this thought, 'That's wonderful!

source_sentence: 我今可能徧於王城內外，悉雨種種珍寶衣服。』
translation: 'Now, I might rain down all kinds of precious clothing inside and outside the king's city.'

source_sentence: 發是心時，忽有種種殊妙衣服，及悅意華諸妙珍寶，自天而降，悉皆充滿王城內外。
translation: When he gave rise to this thought, suddenly a variety of marvelous clothing and the delightful flowers and wonderful treasures rained down from the heavens and filled the interior and exterior of the king's city.

source_sentence: 現是相時，人天胥悅，咸生驚異，悉起廣大淨信之心，俱發是言：『快哉！
translation: When this happened, the people and gods were delighted and amazed, and they all arose with great pure faith, saying, 'That's wonderful!'

source_sentence: 天子，有是福力，具大威德。』
translation: 'Son of gods, that king has such fortunate powers and possesses great authority.'

source_sentence: 「復次其後諸小國王，聞是事已，咸起思念：『彼王有大福力，具大名稱，我今宜應往彼尊奉。』
translation: "Furthermore, when the kings of the smaller states who followed heard this, they all thought, 'That king has great powers of merit and a great reputation, so now it would be appropriate for me to go there and venerate him.'

source_sentence: 由是諸王共會一處，各領四兵，所謂象、馬、車、步兵眾，同詣福力王所，下車前進，肅恭伸拜，合掌白言：『天子大福，具大名稱，為大國王，威德特尊，我等今時故來親奉。』
translation: The kings then met together in one place, each led a group of four soldiers, called the elephant, horse, chariot, and foot soldiers, and together they went to King Fuli, got out, advanced, paid respectful prostrations, put their palms together, and said, 'The gods' son is greatly blessed, has a great reputation, and is the king of a great country with exceptional authority, so we've come to pay our respects.'

source_sentence: 「時福力王，即復致問，普為慰安，如次坐已，并其官屬，各與無價上妙珍寶；又以十善法門，普為攝化。
translation: "After he had sat down in turn, he and his officials each gave him priceless and marvelous treasures, and he also gave them the ten good dharma teachings to guide and guide them.

source_sentence: 是時諸王，俱獲勝利，各還本國。
translation: The kings then all received excellent benefits and each returned to his native land.

source_sentence: 「復次，其後父眼力王，展轉聞知如是奇事，先遣使人詣彼國已，自當速疾與諸官屬，終日竟夜，促途前進。
translation: "Furthermore, after that, Father Eyesight King, who had heard of such a wonderful thing in turn, first sent an envoy to that country, and then he quickly took his officials and hastened on with them for the rest of the day and night.

source_sentence: 父王到已，愛念子故，即時遙見，雙目淚垂，悲喜交盈，聲哀心切，速從車下，前執其手，久而視之，父王乃言：『我是汝父，汝必深知，我今年耄衰朽若斯，國政甚難，我不堪任，今付於汝，汝當負荷。』
translation: When the father arrived, he was so fond of his son that he immediately saw him from a distance, his eyes dropping in tears, his heart filled with sadness and joy, and his voice so sorrowful that he quickly descended from the chariot, took his hand, and looked at it for a long time.

source_sentence: 言已即時卸自寶冠，置於子頂，子如父教，兼統其國。
translation: Immediately after he said that, he removed his own jeweled crown and placed it on the crown of his son, who, like his father had taught him, ruled his country as well.

source_sentence: 佛說福力太子因緣經卷第三
translation: Foshuo fuli taizi yinnian jing, vol. 3
